context: "Algust" is the partitive form of "algus" (beginning/start) and appears in the context of starting or beginning something. It's commonly used with verbs like "saama" (to get), "hakkama" (to start/begin), and "kätte jõudma" (to arrive/reach). In Estonian, this form indicates that one is getting into a process of beginning something or that the beginning has arrived.
